attributes.action: Lifetime ban on owning animals and prison for convictions of animal cruelty.
attributes.additional_details: There are too many cases of animal cruelty going to court. In these cases animals are subjected to horrific injuries and torment, starvation, dehydration, abandonment and death. The sentences do not create enough deterrent or reflect the seriousness of the crime. The sentences handed out in most cases equate to a slap on the wrist particularly when solicitors use mental health issues as an excuse for the unacceptable behaviour.
attributes.background: Change the law and sentencing guidelines to award a mandatory prison sentence and a lifetime ban on owning or caring for any animal for anyone convicted of animal cruelty.

rejection.details:
The following petition calls for a similar action: 

Ban Private Dog Breeding and Strengthen Penalties for Animal Cruelty 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/728177
